titleStmt.title: Ray Raymond v. Territory of Washington. Testimony of Frankie Snitzinger

distributor.name: Center for Digital Research in the Humanities

bibl.title: Ray Raymond v. Territory of Washington. Testimony of Frankie Snitzinger
bibl.note: Our transcription is based on a digital image of the microfilmed original.

div1.p: Frankie Snitzinger Sworn

I live in Spokane Falls W.T. have resided here two years last October was in attendance here at this trial yesterday heard part of the testimony of Dr. Morgan heard the testmony of Jno Mayterss no 33 is My house the one spoken of in his testimony Heard part of the description of the dead Man, there such a person called of my play, a little before 11PM night of 25th, He was in the house my front door was open and he walked in no one gave him permission when my front door is open the inside is shut He was quite happy from his He came in the front and opened my parlor door and I said how do you do he said is my friend here I say says no there has been no one here he said my friend said he was comming here and I think he is here, no I told him no one was here he would know No Stranger had been here he answered by saying you are a lying, Old Bitch I told him not to speek lke that and he reached up his hands and said I have a notion to break your face
I says dont break my face he says I feel like doing it you are to smart in this town you wount to get licked I said to him you would not strike an old lady lets come promise and take a drink he says no I wont beat if you'll treat I'll drink I asked him to sit down and if you will treat first then I will, I was there alone and a little araid of him

He stepped past me to my dinning room door and I turned round and said I don't want you to go in there, there is no one in "there he reached out and took me by the arm and said I will go in there I'll kick the belly off you I reached my hand up to him and took lead of the little cord on his shirt and said dont be cross lets be friends he said no I want my friend

I asked him who his friend was he said little fellow that came with him off the R.R. and described Johnny May bliss saying he had reason to believe he was there because he had asked for Miss Zorf and was told she
got a 33 and heard Johny as looking for her he said my little Miss told me I asked him to stay that may be his friend would come said no he would go and hurt him he stood while he was there would not sit down was quite intoxicated and reeling when he went out managed to get into the dinning room then out into the hall and not I followed him to the hall door and then locked it, Had no hat on
Cross

I was talking about a man dont know his name, never saw him before, nor sing, no I never heard his name dont presume to say he was the man did not see him after he was dead no one else heard this language I was alone I asked him to sit down done all I could to quiet him I asked him to treat to a glass beer yes I have beer there
Redirect
he was a man answering the disinformation gven by Dr. Morgan yesterday
Re Cros
I was here in the room while Dr Morgan gave his testemant
Redirect

He was above the av heighth he shoot very near me I had to look up to see him leighth faded Moustache Drooped heavy at the Corners a little sunken in the cheeks heavy chin heavy forhead looked heavy over his eyes hands rough working hands gad them on her face was harsh his face clean and hair smooth Face smooth except Mustache looked as though had just cleand up upper clothing clean lower soiled smeared somewhat no Hat on asked him where it was Con blue overalls
I did not see the man after he was dead ans describing the Man who Called at my house
Recross

Had rough weather beaten hand did not like them on my face had on Blue Overalls I dont presume to say he was the Man is what I said, He came there asking for his friend and Called him Johny and described Johny May bliss the reason I tought it was Mayterss was because he inquired for a little fellow that got acuainted with Zorf at Coeur d'Alene I knew Johny
May bliss before, my front door slams open good deal in warm weather at night I know the Prisoner at the bar, have not talked with me about my testimony have not set by her ever Counsler has ever me asked if such a man visited my home
Redirect

Saw a torn peice of paper that looked like the one he had it in his hand I asked him to meet you perhaps need your quarter to get somthing to eat he says no I've got money if I could get money & my papers I could buy your old house showed me a small square piece of paper whch seemed to me that could file this, towrn ACross the Center folds Said a man worked hard in his country and got les ¢ on the dollar for his work
Recross
No only by the size and appearance and only by its being torn dont pressure to say it was the same man that was killed beacuse I did not see him
Frankie Snitzinger
Subscribed and Sworn to before me on this June 30th 1886
JJL Peel
Justice of the Peace
